title: Agnostic Karl DESTROYS Sam Harris :) Implicit vs Explicit Knowledge
description:
Karl is an enthusiastic viewer and comment writer on this channel and we finally get a chance to have a conversation. He's appeared regularly on Karen's channel "The Meaning Code". He's got an advanced degree in physics, had a career as a fighter pilot, and engineer and a contractor for the US Air Force. He's quite a guy as you will see. 

The Meaning Code Channel https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCgp_r6WlBwDSJrP43Mz07GQ
Karl, Ira and Karen on Austrian School of Economics https://youtu.be/9OG17kp8FnA

Notes from our talk
Airforce, family
Grew up Catholic
Estonia and France
Father’s side lutheran, mother’s side catholic
Confirmed Lutheran
Always felt closer to religious people than atheist, considers himself an agnostic
UC Berkeley engineering physics
Don’t feel the need to believe in a supernatural god
Sam Harris asserts that if knowledge is not explicit it doesn’t exist
Distributed cognition is critical
Frederick Hayek economist
Vernon Smith economist book: rationality in economics, constructive vs ecological
Michael Polanyi Tacit 
Esther Meek and Dru Johnson
Implicit vs. explicit knowledge
Vervaeke
Jordan Peterson
Complex systems, complexity theory
Complicated systems, Direct relationship. 
Complex systems are fundamentally unpredictable by any scientific means
Simple complex system, double-joined pendulum, there’s no general equation to figure it out
Formally impossible, Stuart Kaufman, 
Expert in complexity. You cannot reduce the world to physics
A system that evolves in response to changes in environment
When you introduce self-reference into any system you have bizarre effects

Cord Godall 
Alan Turing
Undecidability theorem
If you introduce self-reference the system becomes completely unpredictable
Physical reductionism and physical determinism are impossible
Persons is a story, we are a history, 
Benjamin Libet experiments
Laplace’s demon, you have to tell me before the event
Self-reference
Valid formal proof that scientific determinism is incorrect
Karl Gruner destroys Sam harris
Strong distinction between physical and natural
“Emerges” from physical processes
Game theory
Nassim Talib (books in the order they were published) Fat tail distributions

Confusing uncertainty with mere probability distribution. Kind of rules to apply to a complex world are very different from the rules we apply to a complicated system. 
Black Swan event
The great danger is thinking you know something that you really don’t
Pseudo scientific confidence in our capacity to predict
They think they know a lot more than they do. 
Daniel Kaneman Thinking Fast and Slow, research is excellent but the conclusion is false. He spoke with Talib. 
Ira Katz
Austrian school of economics
Anarchists
Externalities, imposing a cost on a third party
Mark Twain quote “what you know but it just ain’t so” 
Donald Hoffman’s our senses are not there to show us a picture of reality, but an interface
Sensory deprivation tank, nothing will 
Our senses give us a model of reality
Our senses are a way to build a model of our world
Multiple senses say that our senses build a model.
